roleset.name: support
roleset.note: BACK-V NOTES: Could be interpreted as phrasal "back_out" also (but I don't likethat). Follow Treebank's parsing. (from back.01-v)
BACKING-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. No VN class. FN class taking_sides. Comparison to 'support'. Framed by Katie. (from backing.01-n)

example.name: support
example.text: ...asking [him]-1 *trace*-1 to back a Palestinian bid to joing the committee.
example.arg: a Palestinian bid to joing the committee

example.name: cease support
example.text: The big brokerage firms back out of program trading for their own accounts or for clients.
example.arg: for their own accounts or for clients.

example.name: cease support, with NP
example.text: Eastern Airline's creditors committee backed off a move to come up with its own alternative proposals to the carrier's bankruptcy reorganization plans.
example.arg: off a move to come up with its own alternative proposals to the carrier's bankruptcy reorganization plans.

roleset.name: move backwards
roleset.note: BACK-V NOTES: Could be interpreted as phrasal "back_away" also. Followthe parsing given by Treebank. (from back.02-v)

example.name: retreat
example.text: The Soviets might back away from the current conciliatory attitude
example.arg: away from the current conciliatory attitude

roleset.name: face backwards
roleset.note: BACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'back' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'face' and 'support' (from back.03-v predicate notes)
BACK-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from back.03-j)

example.name: with PP
example.text: John's house backs onto the city dump.

example.name: Reaganomics
example.text: [You]-1 should quote Mr. Reagan, the man who believed trees cause air pollution, *trace*-1 to back up your position that economics is more important than the Earth.
example.arg: your position that economics is more important than the Earth.

example.name: oops
example.text: The garbage truck backed up into John's living room.

example.name: double oops
example.text: John backed the garbage truck up into Mary's living room.

example.name: icky
example.text: John's house backs up to the city dump.

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: Exabyte Corp., a Boulder, Colo., maker of [high-capacity tape cartridge systems]*-1 used [*][*-1] to back up computer disk drives, started OTC trading with the symbol EXBT.

example.name: Schuylkill expressway
example.text: The companies block traffic much as highway on-ramps are blocked when traffic backs up.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: When his arm came up [*T*-1] I ducked away but it caught me on the side of the neck , [*-2]watering my eyes , and I backed off [*-3] to cough .
